title: How to Make a Kentucky Derby Pie

steps.headline: Using a whisk or electric mixer, beat the eggs together with the melted butter in the mixing bowl.
Add the sugar and continue mixing until the batter is smooth and creamy.
Mix in the flour, stirring until it’s well incorporated.
Add the walnuts, chocolate chips, and vanilla and mix thoroughly.
steps.description: If you have a mixer, Keep the mixer on low to avoid breaking the chocolate chips into small bits.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the pie crust and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake until the top is golden, or a toothpick inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean, about 30 to 35 minutes.
steps.description: Ensure even baking by placing the pie on the top rack for the first 15 minutes and on the bottom rack for the last 15.

steps.headline: Allow the pie to cool for 2-3 hours.
Add a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream as a finishing touch.

text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Using a whisk or electric mixer, beat the eggs together with the melted butter in the mixing bowl.  Add the sugar and continue mixing until the batter is smooth and creamy.  Mix in the flour, stirring until it’s well incorporated.  Add the walnuts, chocolate chips, and vanilla and mix thoroughly. If you have a mixer, Keep the mixer on low to avoid breaking the chocolate chips into small bits. Pour the batter into the pie crust and smooth the top with a spatula.  Bake until the top is golden, or a toothpick inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean, about 30 to 35 minutes. Ensure even baking by placing the pie on the top rack for the first 15 minutes and on the bottom rack for the last 15. Allow the pie to cool for 2-3 hours.  Add a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream as a finishing touch. Eat up! Delicious!
